name: Yallaiah Onteru
title: Lead QA Automation Engineer
professional_summary: Utilized [Java, Selenium] to design and implement automation frameworks for healthcare claims processing, reducing manual effort by ensuring consistent test execution across Molina Healthcare's provider portals.

Built hybrid frameworks combining [Data-Driven and BDD models] using [Cucumber, Gherkin] for State of Washington's government portals, improving test maintainability and collaboration with business stakeholders.
Mentored QA team members on [framework development, CI/CD integration] using [Jenkins, Git] at State of Washington, enhancing team productivity and code quality through regular code reviews.
Contributed to reusable framework components and shared libraries in [Python, PyTest] for Molina Healthcare, streamlining test creation and maintenance across multiple projects.
Executed [end-to-end functional testing] for banking workflows at Comerica using [Cypress, REST Assured], ensuring seamless integration of payment and trade booking APIs.
Collaborated with product owners and business SMEs at Molina Healthcare to design and execute [manual and automated tests] for complex claims and eligibility workflows.
Coordinated [UAT sessions] with business stakeholders at State of Washington, ensuring alignment between system functionality and business requirements.
Managed the full [defect lifecycle] using [JIRA, Azure DevOps] across multiple projects, improving defect resolution time and system stability.
Conducted [performance and load testing] with [Apache JMeter] for high-volume claims and eligibility flows at Molina Healthcare, identifying and resolving bottlenecks to improve system scalability.
Performed [regression, smoke, and post-deployment validation] for healthcare provider portals at Molina Healthcare using [Selenium, TestNG], ensuring system reliability after each release.
Implemented [CI/CD pipelines] using [Jenkins, Docker] for State of Washington's government portals, enabling faster and more reliable test execution and deployment.
Utilized [SQL, PostgreSQL] to validate data integrity and accuracy in healthcare claims processing systems at Molina Healthcare, ensuring compliance with HIPAA regulations.
Designed and executed [manual test cases] for complex banking workflows at Comerica, ensuring comprehensive coverage of functional requirements and edge cases.
Conducted [performance testing] with [Apache JMeter] for high-volume payment and trade booking APIs at Comerica, providing recommendations to improve system performance and scalability.
Collaborated with cross-functional teams at State of Washington to define [test strategies] and ensure comprehensive test coverage for government portals.
Implemented [automated regression suites] using [Selenium, Java] for Molina Healthcare, reducing regression testing time and improving overall test efficiency.
Utilized [ServiceNow] to manage and track defects for State of Washington's government portals, ensuring timely resolution and system stability.
Contributed to [test automation initiatives] at Comerica by building and maintaining automated test scripts using [Cypress, JavaScript], improving test coverage and reducing manual testing effort.
